results.title: Red poll
results.brief_description: The Red Poll breed of cattle, which originated in East Anglia, England, is enjoying an increasing popularity throughout the world. It is a dual-purpose breed, providing milk and beef combined. The film explains to farmers the breed’s main characteristics and its advantages.

results.title: Red Nightmare
results.creator_credit: George Waggner, William L. Hendricks, United States. Dept. of Defense and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An anti communist drama sponsored by the U.S Government, supervised by Jack L. Warner and produced during the Cold War. The drama revolves around a small town American who takes his civil liberties for granted until he dreams of a communist takeover which jolts him out of his complacency. Narrated by Jack Webb. Photographed by Robert Hoffman. Written by Vincent Fotre. Music by William Lava. Edited by Folmer Blargsted. Starring Jack Kelly, Jeanne Cooper, Andrew Duggan, Peter Brown, Patricia Woodell, Peter Breck, Robert Conrad, Mike Road.

results.title: Red Matildas
results.creator_credit: Trevor Graham, Sharon Connolly and Yarra Bank Films
results.brief_description: Through the lives of three women, Audrey Blake, May Pennefather and Joan Goodwin, “Red Matildas” explores the social and political conditions in Australia during the Great Depression - conditions of massive unemployment, widespread malnutrition and growing militarism at home and abroad, that provoked many people to political activity. May Pennefather served 12-18 months in the Spanish Civil War. Cinematographer: Laurie McInnes

results.title: Red light in full flight
results.creator_credit: Samia Mikhail, Sharyn Prentice and Flamingo Star Films
results.brief_description: The culture of Middle eastern belly dancing in Australia is a prolific one, with belly dancers in Australia outnumbering dancers in other countries. The director gleans anecdotes about the history of this sensual womens’ dance and interviews Australian dancers about their dance, their lives and their culture. It also discusses the importance of traditional cultural dance in women’s lives.

results.title: Red house
results.creator_credit: Delmer Daves, Col Lesser and JEF Films
results.brief_description: What is the macabre secret of the terrifying Red House? Hidden deep within the spooky Oxhead Woods, it guards hidden mysteries of the dark past - puzzlements of passions and torture that threaten to surface and shatter innocent lives. Highlighted by atmospheric photography and a clever script, superb acting from Edward G. Robinson, Lon McCallister and Judith Anderson, with eerie blood-chilling music, this film is a blockbuster of a suspense thriller you will not soon forget.

results.title: Red Hook Summer
results.brief_description: Red Hook Summer is a 2012 American film co-written and directed by Spike Lee. It is Lee’s sixth film in his “Chronicles of Brooklyn” series following She’s Gotta Have It, Do the Right Thing, Crooklyn, Clockers, and He Got Game.

constellations_other.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

results.description: When his mom deposits him at the Red Hook housing project in Brooklyn to spend the summer with the grandfather he’s never met, young Flik may as well have landed on Mars. Fresh from his cushy life in Atlanta, he’s bored and friendless, and his strict grandfather, Enoch, a firebrand preacher, is bent on getting him to accept Jesus Christ as his personal savior. Only Chazz, the feisty girl from church, provides a diversion from the drudgery. As hot summer simmers and Sunday mornings brim with Enoch’s operatic sermons, things turn anything but dull as people’s conflicting agendas collide.

results.title: Red heat (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Walter Hill, Gordon Carroll and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Russia’s deadliest drug smuggler has gone to Chicago to gain dominance of the drug market in the United States. Moscow’s most disciplined police officer is sent over to hunt him down, working in collaboration with a wise-cracking U.S. detective who follows his own rules. Starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and James Belushi, “Red Heat” is a well-crafted mix of humour and action with some deftly executed stunt sequences.

results.title: Red firecracker, green firecracker [DVD] = Pao da shuang deng
results.creator_credit: He Ping, Yung Naiming, Chan Chun-Keung and Yung and Associates
results.brief_description: Cai Chunzhi’s (Jing Ning) family own a prosperous firecracker factory on the banks of the Yellow River in Northern China. When her father dies, because she is the only child she inherits the factory and becomes “Master”. She dresses like a man and everyone addresses her as “Master” but as a woman, her hold on power is tenuous and she carefully respects the authority of the factory head, Man Dihong. When she hires an artist to paint door gods for the Chinese New Year her life is turned upside down. Niu Bao is a handsome young painter whose pride and headstrong nature put him on a collision course with Dihong, as Bao and his ‘master’ struggle with their attraction to each other. Winner of 3 Golden Rooster Awards (the Chinese equivalent of the Oscars). Based on the novel by Feng Jicai.

results.title: Red ensign
results.creator_credit: Michael Powell, Jerome Jackson and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: This is the story of David Barr, a shipbuilder, who fights to keep the shipyards open during the Depression of the 1930’s. David Barr fights the cautious businessman, Lord Dean, both for the affection of the heiress, June MacKinnon, and for the use of her money to finance his construction program. Stars Leslie Banks, Carol Goodner, Alfred Drayton, Frank Vosper.

results.title: Red Dwarf I. The End
results.brief_description: This tape features the pilot show for the series, “The End”, in which bickering room mates and co-maintenance workers Rimmer and Lister are the sole survivors of the mining ship Red Dwarf after it suffers severe radiation, thanks to an incorrectly sealed drive plate courtesy of Rimmer. Joining the human Lister and hologram Rimmer, are computer Holly and Rimmer’s cat who has now come to life. “Future echoes”: The Red Dwarf breaks the light barrier and Holly is having trouble navigating. Cat’s having trouble narrowing down the number of suits he can take into stasis in preparation, and Lister and Rimmer are subjected to future echoes - visions of what lies ahead. “Balance of power”: Lister reminisces about Saturday nights gone past carousing with fellow crew members. He threatens to pass the officer’s exam so that Rimmer will no longer wield power over him and give himself the authority to achieve everything he desires; cigarettes and a holographic Kochanski. Cast includes: Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Norman Lovett. Episodes written by Rob Grant and Doug Naylor. According to the official “Red Dwarf” website, the series is BBC2’s longest running and highest rating sit-com. A film is due for completion in September 2003.
